title: Fix api bug cannot exclude two more parameters
body:
### What we’re after
In order to filter by exclusion parameter on api, we need pass parameter like `-value`.
currently our api only support exclude one parameter. We should fix it to allow api exclude one or more parameters.
examples:
return 154 rows:
https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/schedules/schedule_a/?api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort_hide_null=false&sort_nulls_last=false&contributor_name=sohn+richard&two_year_transaction_period=2022&min_date=01%2F01%2F2021&max_date=12%2F31%2F2022&sort=-contribution_receipt_date&per_page=30&is_individual=true

return 47 rows:
https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/schedules/schedule_a/?api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort_hide_null=false&sort_nulls_last=false&contributor_name=sohn+richard&two_year_transaction_period=2022&min_date=01%2F01%2F2021&max_date=12%2F31%2F2022&sort=-contribution_receipt_date&per_page=30&is_individual=true&committee_id=-C00694323

### Action item(s)
- [ ] Find the root cause why two more parameters excluding not work.
- [ ] Fix it
- [ ] Add autotest

### Completion criteria

title: Bug: Candidate contributions excluded when using unique individuals filter
body:
### What we’re after

Bug for 11D and 17D transactions if you use the "From unique individuals only" filter on the All Receipts data table. Here's an example using Mike Bloomberg's presidential data. The same issue happens for congressional candidates. The correct answer is 2,122 transactions.

Bloomberg candidate contributions: 2,122 transactions
https://www.fec.gov/data/receipts/?data_type=processed&committee_id=C00728154&two_year_transaction_period=2020&line_number=F3P-17D

Bloomberg candidate contributions add "From unique individuals only" filter:  0 transactions
https://www.fec.gov/data/receipts/?data_type=processed&committee_id=C00728154&two_year_transaction_period=2020&is_individual=true&line_number=F3P-17D


### Completion criteria

- [ ] Candidate contributions (Line 11D, Form 3X and Line 17D, Form 3P) should be included in the result set when the unique individuals filter is selected currently using the filter drops candidate contributions.

title: Debug api "502 Bad Gateway" issue
body:
### What we’re after
Recently, some api users report get the following error frequently :
"502 Bad Gateway: Registered endpoint failed to handle the request." when per_page > some number (like 100, 80.. on a couple of endpoints)

From user 1 's email:
```
Unsure as to what may be causing the error, but I continue to receive a 502 error when running the below request:
https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/committee/C00075820/reports/?sort_hide_null=false&per_page=100&api_key=DEMO_KEY&page=1&sort=-coverage_end_date&sort_null_only=false&sort_nulls_last=false
Result: 502 Bad Gateway: Registered endpoint failed to handle the request.

However, if I change the results per page to anything 50 and below, the request is successful.
 
https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/committee/C00075820/reports/?sort_hide_null=false&per_page=50&api_key=DEMO_KEY&page=1&sort=-coverage_end_date&sort_null_only=false&sort_nulls_last=false
 
This is the case for only this committee. I have run five other party committee reports and have been able to use 100 results per page. 
```
From user 2 's email:
```
here's a URL that gave the "502 Bad Gateway" issue while I was scraping Disbursement data for the 2002 election cycle.

https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/schedules/schedule_b/?sort_null_only=false&api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort_hide_null=false&two_year_transaction_period=2002&per_page=100&sort=-disbursement_date&last_index=3062020110010618030&last_disbursement_date=2001-02-27T00:00:00
```
There is no issue on local api env. (connect dev db)
- Ref [https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/issues/4489](https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/issues/4489)

### Action item(s)
- [ ] Identify the root cause of this issue
- [ ] Fix the "502 Bad Gateway" issue

### Completion criteria
- [ ] We know what caused the 502s
and
- [ ] the queries in this ticket no longer throw a 502, or
- [ ] we have created ticket(s) to fix it

title: Add validation for filter parameter 'beginning_image_number'
body: ### Summary From log file, we found Error: 2022-03-30 20:46:28 UTC:ec2-52-222-123-172.[us-gov-west-1.compute.amazonaws.com](http://us-gov-west-1.compute.amazonaws.com/)(48929):fec_api@fec:[6131]:ERROR: invalid input syntax for type bigint: "FEC-1489253" at character 4737 2022-03-30 20:46:28 UTC:ec2-52-222-123-172.us-gov-west-1.compute.amazonaws.com(48929):fec_api@fec:[6131]:E**RROR: invalid input syntax for type bigint: "FEC-1489253"** at character 4737[fecct-prod-aurora13-west-instance-2.2](https://us-west-2.console.aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/home?region=us-west-2#logsV2:log-groups/log-group/$252Faws$252Frds$252Fcluster$252Ffecct-prod-aurora13-west-cluster$252Fpostgresql/log-events/fecct-prod-aurora13-west-instance-2.2$3Fstart$3D1648673187900$26refEventId$3D36766640681237175372375391448125894690163300011501027409) This may be a case of bad parameter passed into our API for image number. the error is from a select query that try to cast "FEC-1489253" string to bigint in the code, e.g., something like this. however, "FEC-1489253" is not number. SELECT CAST("FEC-1489253") as bigint), Maybe FEC-1489253 to 1489253 by validation in code? We need dev team help to resolve it. ### Action item(s) - [ ] Add validation for filter 'beginning_image_number' in these endpoints: Filings: /filings.py /candidate/{candidate_id}/filings/ /committee/{committee_id}/reports/ /operations_log.py Financial: /reports/{entity_type}/ Communication cost: /communication_costs/ /schedules/schedule_a/ /schedules/schedule_a/efile/ /schedules/schedule_b/ /schedules/schedule_b/efile/ /schedules/schedule_c/ /schedules/schedule_d/ /schedules/schedule_f/ - [ ] Add test case ### Completion criteria - [ ] When user input image number with invalid format, get alert message with 422 status.

title: Fix 404 error when a case is unpublished
body: ## Summary (required) Elasticsearch service throws a 404 error trying to delete a unpublish case (MUR, ADR or AF) from the website. - Resolves #5013 - Remove the double quotes surrounding the id, when a case is deleted by its id. ### Required reviewers One developer ## Impacted areas of the application - Enforcements/MUR, ADR and AF ## How to test (on local workspace): **You need Redis and Elasticsearch services setup and running on your local** - checkout feature/fix-unpublish-case-404-error - comment all the scheduled tasks in /webservices/tasks/__init__.py except `refresh_legal_docs` - In `/webservices/tasks/__init__.py` change the `refresh_legal_docs` task to run every 1 minute (For quick testing purpose only) ``` "refresh_legal_docs": { "task": "webservices.tasks.legal_docs.refresh_most_recent_legal_doc", "schedule": crontab(minute="*/1"), }, ``` - Comment the SSL related code in webservices/tasks/__init__.py: ``` broker_url=redis_url(), # broker_use_ssl={ # "ssl_cert_reqs": ssl.CERT_NONE, # }, # redis_backend_use_ssl={ # "ssl_cert_reqs": ssl.CERT_NONE, # }, ``` - Remove ssl from the redis URL in webservices/tasks/__init__.py: ``` app.conf.ONCE = { "backend": "celery_once.backends.Redis", "settings": { "url": redis_url() , "default_timeout": 60 * 60 } } ``` - Terminal 1: start local redis server : `redis-server` - Terminal 2: start local elasticsearch service: `./elasticsearch` - Terminal 3: start local API server : -- activate python virtual env -- export `SQLA_CONN` to `Dev` DB -- `./manage.py runserver` - Terminal 4: start celery beat: -- activate python virtual env -- `celery beat --app webservices.tasks --loglevel INFO` - Terminal 5: start celery worker: -- activate python virtual env -- `celery worker --app webservices.tasks --loglevel INFO` - pg admin: Run these scripts to update `pg_admin` date and `published_flg` columns on case table: ``` UPDATE fecmur.case set published_flg='true' where case_id='412' ``` ``` UPDATE fecmur.case SET pg_date = NOW() where case_id='412'; ``` ``` select * from fecmur.case where case_id='412' ``` ## Screenshots when a case is published to Elasticsearch service: **Celery beat:** **Celery worker:** **Browser:** ## Screenshots when a case is unpublished from Elasticsearch service: **Celery beat:** **Celery worker:** **Browser:**

title: Modify AO reload to handle multiple modified AOs
body:
### What we’re after

Right now, as written, the AO reload task (`refresh_most_recent_aos`) will only reload one AO per day, even if more than one is modified. We should modify the AO reload task to work more like the case reload task (`refresh_most_recent_cases`) to loop through all modified AOs and load them to elasticsearch. 
cc: @fec-jli 

### Related ticket(s)
- https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/issues/4967
- https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/issues/4971

### Completion criteria
- [ ] We are able to publish more than one AO per day

title: Reload all AOs cannot finish on dev space
body:
Currently, we schedule three tasks to reload/refresh AOs:
Task 1: Every 5 minutes during 6am-7pm(EST)everyday--when there is modified AO, reload all AOs from recently modified starting AO number to the latest AO.
Task 2: Daily at 9pm(EST) except Sunday: when there is modified AO in the past 24 hour, reload all AOs.
Task 3: Every Sunday at 9pm(EST)--reload All AOs.

Issues we have now:
1)Usually,It will take 20-30 minutes to reload all AOs, depends on space.
Sometime it is fail to reload all AOs on dev space.
2)When one AO get modify, AO citations go back and forward, it is difficult to find the earliest AO number be referenced. We have to reload all AOs.

### Action item(s)

- [x] Research to find a good way to get the the earliest AO number be referenced when AO is modified (database side or python code side)
- [x] re-design and implement the reload AO logic

### Completion criteria
- [x] When AO is modified, all AOs referenced by this can be reload to ES correctly and efficiently.
- [x] Send AO detail info and reload message to Slack

title: Fix daily reload all AOs when modified issue
body:
### What we’re after
We have a schedule task -- reload_all_aos_daily_except_sunday
that will daily reload all AOs starting from earliest to current that were new or modified in the past 24 hours.

The current code issue is to call reload function load_advisory_opinions() by no argument that will reload all AOs start from beginning to the current.
This PR will fix to call function `load_advisory_opinions(row["ao_no"])` by passing starting AO number that will reload all AOs starting from **row["ao_no"]** to current AO.
Also update message send to Slack.


### Completion criteria
- [ ] call upload function by passing starting AO number
- [ ] update the message send to Slack


### References/resources/technical considerations
PR: [https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/pull/4957](https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/pull/4957)

title: Investigate high celery-worker memory
body:
### What we’re after

On 5/20/21, MUR 7284 didn't appear more than an hour after publishing.

Celery-worker instances throwing `Worker exited prematurely: signal 9 (SIGKILL)` errors increasingly in the past month, which seems to correlate with celery-worker memory creeping up from 800MB/1GB to >=1GB/1GB. 

We should either: 
- Increase celery-worker memory or
- Determine the cause of high memory usage and address it. 
- Consider updating celery/kombu versions

Example:

```
 2021-05-20T12:10:00.10-0400 [APP/PROC/WEB/2] ERR [2021-05-20 16:10:00,101: INFO/ForkPoolWorker-10] Checking for modified cases
   2021-05-20T12:10:00.10-0400 [APP/PROC/WEB/2] ERR [2021-05-20 16:10:00,104: INFO/ForkPoolWorker-10] MUR 7284 found modified at 2021-05-20 11:00:11.016174
   2021-05-20T12:10:00.10-0400 [APP/PROC/WEB/2] ERR [2021-05-20 16:10:00,105: INFO/ForkPoolWorker-10] Loading MUR(s)
   2021-05-20T12:10:07.73-0400 [APP/PROC/WEB/2] ERR [2021-05-20 16:10:07,738: ERROR/MainProcess] Process 'ForkPoolWorker-10' pid:87 exited with 'signal 9 (SIGKILL)'
   2021-05-20T12:10:07.75-0400 [APP/PROC/WEB/2] ERR [2021-05-20 16:10:07,752: ERROR/MainProcess] Task handler raised error: WorkerLostError('Worker exited prematurely: signal 9 (SIGKILL) Job: 5259.')
   2021-05-20T12:10:07.75-0400 [APP/PROC/WEB/2] ERR Traceback (most recent call last):
   2021-05-20T12:10:07.75-0400 [APP/PROC/WEB/2] ERR   File "/home/vcap/deps/0/python/lib/python3.7/site-packages/billiard/pool.py", line 1267, in mark_as_worker_lost
   2021-05-20T12:10:07.75-0400 [APP/PROC/WEB/2] ERR     human_status(exitcode), job._job),
   2021-05-20T12:10:07.75-0400 [APP/PROC/WEB/2] ERR billiard.exceptions.WorkerLostError: Worker exited prematurely: signal 9 (SIGKILL) Job: 5259.
 ```

[Kibana app health tracking](https://logs.fr.cloud.gov/app/dashboards#/view/App-Metrics?_g=(filters:!(),refreshInterval:(pause:!t,value:0),time:(from:now-3M,to:now))&_a=(description:'',filters:!(('$state':(store:appState),meta:(alias:!n,disabled:!f,key:query,negate:!f,type:query_string,value:'*'),query:(query_string:(analyze_wildcard:!t,query:'*'))),('$state':(store:appState),meta:(alias:!n,disabled:!f,index:'logs-app*',key:'@cf.app',negate:!f,params:(query:celery-worker),type:phrase),query:(match_phrase:('@cf.app':celery-worker)))),fullScreenMode:!f,options:(darkTheme:!f),query:(language:kuery,query:''),timeRestore:!f,title:'App%20-%20Metrics',viewMode:view)) example.

title: AO entities "name" is missing for individuals
body:
### Summary
The AO entities "name" field is missing for individuals. We suspect this may be a problem for AOs 2019-14 through 2021-02.

Example: https://stage.fec.gov/data/legal/advisory-opinions/2020-04/
There's a missing name for this individual in the AO entities table.

API call: https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/legal/docs/advisory_opinions/2020-04?api_key=DEMO_KEY

![Screen Shot 2021-01-21 at 9 47 04 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12799132/105366712-a6375700-5bcd-11eb-8579-c42381d9c23f.png)
![Screen Shot 2021-01-21 at 9 46 51 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12799132/105366713-a6375700-5bcd-11eb-9309-ebddfbcb10bc.png)

### Related issues
#4443 

**Here is the query to identify missing entities:**
```
 SELECT 
     entity.name as entity_name,
     ao_parsed.ao_id, 
     ao_parsed.ao_no, 
     ao_parsed.name, 
     ao_parsed.summary, 
     ao_parsed.req_date, 
     ao_parsed.issue_date, 
     ao.stage 
     
    FROM aouser.aos_with_parsed_numbers ao_parsed 
    INNER JOIN aouser.ao ao 
     ON ao_parsed.ao_id = ao.ao_id 
    INNER JOIN aouser.players p ON p.ao_id = ao.ao_id
    INNER JOIN aouser.entity entity USING (entity_id)
    INNER JOIN aouser.entity_type et ON et.entity_type_id = entity.type
    INNER JOIN aouser.role r USING (role_id)
	WHERE entity.name=''
    ORDER BY ao_parsed.ao_year, ao_parsed.ao_serial 
	
```

title: Reports missing from /committee/<committee_id>/reports
body:
From an api user: 

> I am trying to retrieve financial information for some committees using the /committee/{committee_id}/reports/ endpoint. While it works great for most committees, the API sometimes returns no data.

> For instance, committee C00672311 does not map to any report if I use the API. But it does when I look at the FEC website (https://www.fec.gov/data/committee/C00672311/?tab=filings&cycle=2018).
> Query:
> https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/committee/C00672311/reports/?api_key=5JX2rcWDNrf0UEmIdVwE8Oab8cg9V27NdAb7pJVs&per_page=100&page=1

> Response:
> `{"api_version":"1.0","pagination":{"page":1,"count":0,"per_page":100,"pages":0},"results":[]}`

It looks like /committee/<committee_id>/reports is filtering by committee type, and since this committee changed types, the reports aren't appearing.

http://localhost:5000/v1/committee/C00672311/reports/?api_key=5JX2rcWDNrf0UEmIdVwE8Oab8cg9V27NdAb7pJVs&per_page=100&page=1
```
SELECT *
FROM ofec_reports_pac_party_mv 
LEFT OUTER JOIN ofec_committee_history_mv AS ofec_committee_history_mv_1 
ON ofec_reports_pac_party_mv.committee_id = ofec_committee_history_mv_1.committee_id 
AND ofec_reports_pac_party_mv.report_year + ofec_reports_pac_party_mv.report_year %% 2 = ofec_committee_history_mv_1.cycle 
WHERE ofec_reports_pac_party_mv.committee_id = 'C00672311'
```

title: 2022 candidates missing from Candidates data table
body:
### Summary
There are two data tables on the site that appear to be listing fewer candidates for office than there are candidates that have registered for office:

[Campaign finance data > Browse data > Candidates ](https://www.fec.gov/data/candidates/?election_year=2022&office=H&is_active_candidate=true)
[Campaign finance data > Browse data > Candidates for house](https://www.fec.gov/data/candidates/house/?election_year=2022&election_full=True&is_active_candidate=true)
[Campaign finance data > Browse data > Candidates for senate](https://www.fec.gov/data/candidates/senate/?election_year=2020&cycle=2020&election_full=true&is_active_candidate=true)

The data tables -- filtered to display House candidates in 2022 -- show 31 candidates (at the time I am writing this). Alternatively, looking at Statement of Candidacy (Form 2) data as a starting point, we have received 138 electronically filed statements of candidacy for candidates registering for 2022. [List attached here](https://app.zenhub.com/files/40841283/df585320-4fe5-4e2a-9f55-bc463bee2123/download). Similarly, I get a proximate result (147) in FECP Disclosure when I run:

```
SELECT election_yr, cand_office,
    COUNT(*) AS numInstances
    FROM disclosure.dim_cand_inf
    WHERE election_yr = '2022'
         and cand_office = 'H'
GROUP BY election_yr, cand_office

```

The candidates in the attachment in the previous paragraph should appear as candidates for 2022 on [this page](https://www.fec.gov/data/candidates/?election_year=2022&office=H&is_active_candidate=true). For the sake of providing specific examples, here are several Candidates that have registered for 2022 House, but do not appear on candidates list today:

- WASHBURN, AMY IRENE (H0WI06194) - F2 received 7/2/2020
- SCALISE, STEVE (H0LA01087) - F2 received 11/12/2020
- PETERS, SCOTT (H2CA52089) - F2 received 11/9/2020
- CHENEY, ELIZABETH (H6WY00159) - F2 received 11/8/2020

I have not reviewed other offices or election cycles to confirm whether this is widespread.

**Completion criteria:**
- [ ] Determine why the list of candidates is not complete for both House and all candidates
- [ ] Determine if the list of candidates is not complete for Senate. If not complete, find out why.
- [ ] The House candidate list is complete in the API endpoint: https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/candidates/totals/?api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort_hide_null=false&sort_nulls_last=true&election_year=2020&election_full=True&is_active_candidate=true&sort=-receipts&per_page=30&page=1&office=H
- [ ] The Senate candidate list is complete in the API endpoint: https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/candidates/totals/?api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort_hide_null=false&sort_nulls_last=true&election_year=2020&cycle=2020&election_full=true&is_active_candidate=true&sort=-receipts&per_page=30&page=1&office=S
- [ ] The candidate list for all offices is complete in the API endpoint: https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/candidates/?api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort_hide_null=false&sort_nulls_last=true&sort=-first_file_date&per_page=30&page=1

title: API sign up key bug
body:
This was reported from a user:

> I visit https://api.open.fec.gov/developers/ , fill out the form titled "Sign up for an API key", and press "Signup". The button briefly changes to "Loading...", then flips back to "Submit". Nothing else happens and I receive no email. I've tried Chrome 85.0.4183.102 and Safari 13.1.2 (15609.3.5.1.3).

Replication:

I was not able to replicate this bug in Chrome and was able to sign up for a key successfully. We should investigate if we can replicate the bug.

- [ ] @jason-upchurch replicated problem from iPhone Safari
- [ ] @jason-upchurch replicated problem from Desktop Safari
- [ ] @jason-upchurch replicated problem from Desktop Firefox

**Technical Considerations**
There are a lot of downstream considerations for this page, e.g., https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/issues/4565. The signup link worked previously and was browser independent. Perhaps as we work through the pain points and page redesign, the best course of action is to return to simply using the link, since the software worked. Then, when we have a more clear picture of what we are after we can revisit either embedding a form or creating a new one entirely.

**Completion criteria:**
- [x]  reach out to API.data.gov for assistance if it's not an "us" problem
- [x] timebox troubleshooting
- [ ] revert if need be, open issues, discuss approach with team.
- [x] Test across multiple browsers to verify issue and pinpoint any specific browser issues

title: Pin greenlet@0.4.16
body:
## Summary (required)

Pins greenlet@0.4.16 since 0.4.17 causes api to go down.

``` 
2020-09-23T11:34:53.41-0400 [APP/PROC/WEB/0] ERR /home/vcap/deps/0/python/lib/python3.7/importlib/_bootstrap.py:219: RuntimeWarning: greenlet.greenlet size changed, may indicate binary incompatibility. Expected 144 from C header, got 152 from PyObject
   2020-09-23T11:34:53.46-0400 [APP/PROC/WEB/0] ERR [2020-09-23 15:34:53 +0000] [6884] [INFO] Booting worker with pid: 6
```

```
TODAY:
       Collecting greenlet>=0.4.14; platform_python_implementation == "CPython"
         Downloading greenlet-0.4.17-cp37-cp37m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl (45 kB)

YESTERDAY:
       Collecting greenlet>=0.4.14; platform_python_implementation == "CPython"
         Downloading greenlet-0.4.16-cp37-cp37m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl (45 kB)
```

```python
greenlet_requires = [
    # We need to watch our greenlet version fairly carefully,
    # since we compile cython code that extends the greenlet object.
    # Binary compatibility would break if the greenlet struct changes.
    # (Which it did in 0.4.14 for Python 3.7)
    'greenlet >= 0.4.17; platform_python_implementation=="CPython"',
]
```

title: Counts for all endpoints are incorrect when 'sort_hide_null=True'
body:
### User story
As a user, I want the endpoints to return correct counts when I use `sort_hide_null=True`  because  I want accurate  results.

### Expected behavior
When we use  `sort_hide_null=True`, it's supposed to hide rows  that have  null values for whatever we are sorting on (e.g., `first_file_date`
(We want count to reflect the number of rows that are shown)

### Actual behavior
- correctly hides the row
- count reflects rows that hidden as well 

Examples  of incorrect behavior:

https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/candidates/?api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort_hide_null=true&sort_nulls_last=true&is_active_candidate=true&sort=-first_file_date 
is the same count as 
https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/candidates/?api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort_hide_null=false&sort_nulls_last=true&is_active_candidate=true&sort=-first_file_date&per_page=100 ➡️ when I confirmed there are records with null `first_file_date` values. 

https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/schedules/schedule_a/?api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort_hide_null=true&sort_nulls_last=false&data_type=processed&committee_id=C00671339&line_number=F3-11AI&sort=-contribution_receipt_date&per_page=100&two_year_transaction_period=2020 
➡️ shows count of 3 and no results

This applies to ItemizedResource and ApiResource endpoints. This means the counts are wrong, and makes pagination really tough because it looks like there are more records than there are. I'm not sure this impacts front-end users. 
I put some tests in the `4626-tests` branch: https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/pull/4627/commits/ff8ab0ac117ced0444187fd98f75c936f5c174b5

**Completion criteria**
- [ ] Counts update for `sort_hide_null=True` 
- [ ] Double-check counts update for `sort_nulls_only=True` 
- [ ] Need to add test cases to check count behavior

### Helpful additions:
This is an example of an API resource being ok (updating counts correctly):
https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/candidates/?api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort_nulls_only=true&sort_nulls_last=true&is_active_candidate=true&sort=-first_file_date&per_page=100

title: Research why published MUR was missing from site and resolve
body:
From contractor:

We published MUR 7594 and are able to see the data in the PG, but are not able to find the case on the website. Can you please look into this and let us know of any issues. 

See follow-up instructions in comment below. 

Verified: https://www.fec.gov/data/legal/search/enforcement/?case_no=7594
 
Following is the query we used: 
```
SELECT V.TBL, V.CNT FROM (
SELECT 'DOCUMENT' as TBL, COUNT(1) as CNT FROM FECMUR.DOCUMENT A join FECMUR.CASE B on A.case_id = B.case_id where B.case_type = 'MUR' and B.case_no in ('7594') UNION
SELECT 'CALENDAR' as TBL, COUNT(*) as CNT FROM FECMUR.CALENDAR A join FECMUR.CASE B on A.case_id = B.case_id where B.case_type = 'MUR' and B.case_no in ('7594') UNION
SELECT 'CASE_SUBJECT' as TBL, COUNT(*) as CNT FROM FECMUR.CASE_SUBJECT A join FECMUR.CASE B on A.case_id = B.case_id where B.case_type = 'MUR' and B.case_no in ('7594') UNION
SELECT 'ELECTIONCYCLE' as TBL, COUNT(*) as CNT FROM FECMUR.ELECTIONCYCLE A join FECMUR.CASE B on A.case_id = B.case_id where B.case_type = 'MUR' and B.case_no in ('7594') UNION
SELECT 'VIOLATIONS' as TBL, COUNT(*) as CNT FROM FECMUR.VIOLATIONS A join FECMUR.CASE B on A.case_id = B.case_id where B.case_type = 'MUR' and B.case_no in ('7594') UNION
SELECT 'VOTES' as TBL, COUNT(*) as CNT FROM FECMUR.VOTES A join FECMUR.CASE B on A.case_id = B.case_id where B.case_type = 'MUR' and B.case_no in ('7594') UNION
SELECT 'COMMISSION' as TBL, COUNT(1) as CNT FROM FECMUR.COMMISSION A join FECMUR.CASE B on A.case_id = B.case_id where B.case_type = 'MUR' and B.case_no in ('7594') UNION
SELECT 'RELATEDOBJECTS' as TBL, COUNT(*) as CNT FROM FECMUR.RELATEDOBJECTS UNION
SELECT 'ENTITY' as TBL, COUNT(*) as CNT FROM FECMUR.ENTITY UNION
SELECT 'SETTLEMENT' as TBL, COUNT(*) as CNT FROM FECMUR.SETTLEMENT A join FECMUR.CASE B on A.case_id = B.case_id where B.case_type = 'MUR' and B.case_no in ('7594') UNION
SELECT 'PLAYERS' as TBL, COUNT(*) as CNT FROM FECMUR.PLAYERS A join FECMUR.CASE B on A.case_id = B.case_id where B.case_type = 'MUR' and B.case_no in ('7594') UNION
SELECT 'CASE' as TBL, COUNT(*) as CNT FROM FECMUR.CASE B where B.case_type = 'MUR' and B.case_no in ('7594')) V ORDER BY V.TBL;
```

**Completion criteria:**
- [ ] Make sure new MURs will appear on the site

title: [MERGE WITH GIT FLOW] Hotfix/4538 fix api key signup load
body:
## Summary (required)

- Resolves #4538 

_Include a summary of proposed changes._
- remove feature flag
- additional js changes (@johnnyporkchops, @rfultz )

## How to test the changes locally

This bug is sometimes hard to reproduce. But @johnnyporkchops and @jason-upchurch confirmed we were able to reproduce on local. So:
- clear browser history
- check out master branch
- run local api, see if form loads, try refreshing until form does not load
- clear browser history (again)
- check out this hotfix branch
- run local api
- test that api key signup form loads with page, refresh, etc.

## Impacted areas of the application
List general components of the application that this PR will affect:
- rest.py
- swagger-ui.html
- docs.py

title: Committee totals missing for one committee
body: Reported in the Google group: > I came across a joint fundraising committee with receipts and disbursements, but calls to the /committee/{committee_id}/totals/ endpoint return an empty result set for that committee. I'm curious why that might be. I couldn't find an existing issue on the committee-totals endpoint that seemed to characterize this. Here are the specific endpoints I called: > > https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/committee/C00701243/totals/?sort_hide_null=false&api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort=-cycle&sort_null_only=false&per_page=20&sort_nulls_last=false&page=1 > (An empty result set is returned.) > > https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/schedules/schedule_a/?per_page=20&sort_hide_null=false&sort_null_only=false&api_key=DEMO_KEY&committee_id=C00701243&sort=contribution_receipt_date > (Returns the first set of the 464 receipts records for this committee.) > > https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/schedules/schedule_b/?sort_hide_null=false&sort_null_only=false&per_page=20&api_key=DEMO_KEY&committee_id=C00701243&sort=-disbursement_date > (Returns the first set of the 77 disbursement records for this committee.) I confirmed that the committee had activity in 2020, but no data appears on the financial summary page. https://www.fec.gov/data/committee/C00701243/?tab=summary **Completion criteria:** - [ ] The data displays correctly on the committee's profile page

title: Fix API key sign up load problem
body:
###  User story
As a user of the api key signup page, I want the page to sign up form to load consistently so that I can  sign up for an api key on the first page load.

### Background
Both  @johnnyporkchops and @jason-upchurch have  observed  the form not loading on the first try. This doesn't seem to happen often, but we've  both seen it. We'd  like to try to ensure the form loads with the page every time.

### Technical considerations
- [x] Timeboxed to handle by Monday and address with the form consistently loading, or the data.gov form link is included
- [x] Do we need to remove the feature flag?
- [x] Is there really a form load lag?
- [x] If so, can we  fix this and make sure the page waits for the form?

**Completion criteria:**
- [x] The form loads consistently each time

title: MURs missing from production
body:
The public records office let us know that they published MURs 7484 and 7514 at 9:15am on 7/29/20 and they were missing at 11am. 


It’s my understanding that "the contractor" handles the inserts to the fecmur.“case” table. I let them know it looks like some MURs published today are showing in the dev and stage Aurora Postgres databases, but not production.
Example: 
```
SELECT “case”.pg_date, “case”.case_id,
   “case”.case_no,
   regexp_replace(“case”.case_no::text, ‘(\d+).*‘::text, ‘\1’::text)::integer AS case_serial,
   “case”.name,
   “case”.case_type,
   “case”.published_flg 
   FROM fecmur.“case”
 WHERE “case”.case_type::text = ANY (ARRAY[‘MUR’::character varying, ‘AF’::character varying, ‘ADR’::character varying]::text[])
 AND pg_date >= NOW() - ‘8 hour’::INTERVAL
 ORDER BY “case”.pg_date desc
 LIMIT 10
```

Has 3 results in `dev` but not `production`

- 7643 (edited document)
- 7484 and 7514 (published)

Waiting to hear back from contractor
- [x] Check the database 
- [x] Check the site

https://www.fec.gov/data/legal/search/enforcement/?case_no=7484
https://www.fec.gov/data/legal/search/enforcement/?case_no=7514
https://www.fec.gov/data/legal/search/enforcement/?case_no=7643

title: Fix the broken sort by candidate_name, committee_name on IE, CC and EC by_candidate endpoint
body: ## Summary (required) Fix the broken sort by candidate_name, committee_name on the following endpoints: 1. Independent Expenditures - ` /schedules/schedule_e/by_candidate/` 2. Communication Cost - `/communication_costs/by_candidate/` 3. Electioneering - `/electioneering/by_candidate/` - Resolves #4360 _Include a summary of proposed changes._ - In resources/aggregates.py : Modify the sort_args in the `CandidateAggregateResource` to include `candidate_name` and `committee_name` - Also added candidate_id and committee_id to sort_args function. While writing additional tests that sorts by those two parameters, pytests are failing with a 422 error. Reason being, these two columns are not found in the views(SE, CC and EC) and they are inherited from the parent class(BaseAggregates). pytests are unable to identify `sort` columns that are not in the views. - Add tests on `/schedules/schedule_e/by_candidate/` endpoint - sort by candidate_name, candidate_id, committee_id, committee_name - Add tests on `electioneering/by_candidate` endpoint - sort by candidate_name, candidate_id - Add tests to `communication_costs/by_candidate` endpoint - sort by candidate_name, candidate_id ## How to test the changes locally - checkout branch - run `git checkout feature/4360-fix-schedule_e-sort` - make sure all pytests pass - run `pytest` - export SQLA_CONN to DEV or STAGE db - start server - run - `./manage.py runserver` - Test **sort by candidate_name, committee_name** on `/schedules/schedule_e/by_candidate/`, `electioneering/by_candidate`, `communication_costs/by_candidate` endpoints. ## Screenshots: title: Fix PAC and Parties total endpoints
body:
## Summary (required)

- Resolves [#4444 ](https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/issues/4444)

_rename column sub_id to idx in backend view_
_remove filer: committee_type_
_fix filter: committee_designation_
_add test case_

## How to test the changes locally

-download branch to local, set SQLA_CONN to DEV
-run `pytest`
-run migration 
-test endpoint: ( a tmp view was created on dev for testing purpose )

modify models/totals.py 
`class CommitteeTotalsPacParty(CommitteeTotals):`
    `__tablename__ = 'ofec_totals_pac_party_vw_tmp_hc'`

check these endpoints:
**Before**
https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/totals/pac/?per_page=10&api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort=-receipts&cycle=2020

title: Entities missing from some AOs
body:
The contractor is working on this. 

Here’s the query:
```
SELECT 
     ao_parsed.ao_id, 
     ao_parsed.ao_no, 
     ao_parsed.name, 
     ao_parsed.summary, 
     ao_parsed.req_date, 
     ao_parsed.issue_date, 
     ao.stage, 
     entities.*
    FROM aouser.aos_with_parsed_numbers ao_parsed 
    INNER JOIN aouser.ao ao 
     ON ao_parsed.ao_id = ao.ao_id 
    LEFT JOIN (SELECT
        p.ao_id,
        e.name,
        et.description AS entity_type_description,
        r.description AS role_description
    FROM aouser.players p
    INNER JOIN aouser.entity e USING (entity_id)
    INNER JOIN aouser.entity_type et ON et.entity_type_id = e.type
    INNER JOIN aouser.role r USING (role_id)
    ) as entities ON ao_parsed.ao_id = entities.ao_id 
    WHERE entities.ao_id IS NULL
    ORDER BY ao_parsed.ao_year, ao_parsed.ao_serial limit 100  
```

title: Research why MURs are missing documents after reload
body:
**What we're after:**
We're experiencing an issue on MUR pages when no documents are present. If no documents are present the page fails to load. To catch missing MUR documents in the future, we should research why this is happening.

Example: https://stage.fec.gov/data/legal/matter-under-review/7620/

Research from prod:

MURs have an earlier `pg_date` than documents.

+-----------+----------------+-------------+----------------------------+-----------------+
| case_no   | case_id        | case_type   | pg_date                    | published_flg   |
|-----------+----------------+-------------+----------------------------+-----------------|
| 7620      | 60000002975456 | MUR         | 2020-05-16 20:23:34.477607 | True            |
+-----------+----------------+-------------+----------------------------+-----------------+

```
SELECT case_no, case_id, case_type, pg_date, published_flg, * 
     FROM fecmur.cases_with_parsed_case_serial_numbers_vw 
     WHERE pg_date >= NOW() - '50 hour'::INTERVAL and case_no='7620' 
     ORDER BY case_serial limit 100                                               
```

```
    SELECT
        doc.document_id,
        mur.case_no,
        mur.case_type,
        doc.filename,
        doc.category,
        doc.description,
        doc.ocrtext,
        doc.fileimage,
        length(fileimage) AS length,
        doc.doc_order_id,
        doc.document_date, doc.*
    FROM fecmur.document doc
    INNER JOIN fecmur.cases_with_parsed_case_serial_numbers_vw mur
        ON mur.case_id = doc.case_id
    WHERE doc.case_id = 60000002975456
    ORDER BY doc.doc_order_id, doc.document_date desc, doc.document_id DESC
  ```

```
pg_date      
2020-05-17 01:17:43.30203
```

**Statements:**
- At the time MURs were reloaded, documents couldn't be found. This has happened before (February)
- It doesn't appear possible to tell whether modified MURs are inserts or updates. Just pg_date.

**Questions:**
- What was changed for the MURs? Salient handles these inserts?
- Can we tell whether on '2020-05-16 20:23:34.477607' (pg_date for the MUR) that there was data in fecmur.document table?
- What happens when AOs are missing documents? Do we need to handle this too?
- Do all MURs have documents? Do we have a way to handle this? Do we need a way?

**Technical requirements:**
- [ ] Figure out why documents aren't being loaded 
- [ ] Add better logging for missing docs
- [ ] Add a slack alert if this happens (MUR without documents - do all MURs have documents?)
- [ ] Better error handling on front end when MUR is missing documents
- [ ] Pair with design/content on missing doc messages

**Completion criteria:**
- [ ] ~Front-end should not error when there are no recent MURs present. The page will still load and show a message for users explaining why there aren't any documents.~ https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/issues/4364
- [ ] Notify Salient that we should know before a reload so we can keep an eye out for errors/issues and query for missing documents

**Related work:**
https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/issues/4364

title: Candidate profile page doesn't show financial summary (Easy implementation)
body:
After this candidate changed his primary committee to PAC ( committee type changes from P to N ),  his candidate profile page doesn't show financial summary any more.  The candidate profile page is designed to include committees with type 'P' and  'A' only.
https://www.fec.gov/data/candidate/P00010298/

The other way to obtain the financial summary is to go to PAC profile page.
https://www.fec.gov/data/committee/C00697441/

**Technical considerations:**
Easy: Fix Pete and high-level 2020 candidates on candidate profile pages and determine what that means, open followup ticket for usability testing
Medium: programmatically identify all candidates where this issue exists, add the mid-cycle conversion logic to the API
Large: Make our data more granular to account for these kinds of changes across all candidates/committees

**Completion criteria:**
- [x] Implement easy solution documented above 
- [x] As necessary, create followup tickets: https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/issues/4419 **Programmatically identify candidates committees converted to a PAC**

title: Missing candidate_election_yr 2018 in ofec_candidate_history_mv for H6MD08549
body:
### Summary
The following query returns a null `candidate_election_year` for `candidate_id` H6MD08549:

```sql
select * from (WITH cycle_data_available AS (SELECT max(cand_valid_fec_yr.fec_election_yr) 
AS max_cycle_available, min(cand_valid_fec_yr.fec_election_yr) AS min_cycle_available 
FROM disclosure.cand_valid_fec_yr), election_yr AS (
SELECT cand_valid_fec_yr.cand_id, cand_valid_fec_yr.cand_election_yr 
FROM disclosure.cand_valid_fec_yr GROUP BY cand_valid_fec_yr.cand_id, cand_valid_fec_yr.cand_election_yr ), cand_election_yrs AS ( 
SELECT election_yr.cand_id, election_yr.cand_election_yr, lead(election_yr.cand_election_yr) 
OVER (PARTITION BY election_yr.cand_id ORDER BY election_yr.cand_election_yr) 
AS next_election FROM election_yr ), fec_yr AS ( 
SELECT cand.cand_valid_yr_id, cand.cand_id, cand.fec_election_yr, cand.cand_election_yr, 
cand.cand_status, cand.cand_ici, cand.cand_office, cand.cand_office_st, 
cand.cand_office_district, cand.cand_pty_affiliation, cand.cand_name, cand.cand_st1, 
cand.cand_st2, cand.cand_city, cand.cand_state, cand.cand_zip, cand.race_pk, 
cand.lst_updt_dt, cand.latest_receipt_dt, cand.user_id_entered, cand.date_entered, 
cand.user_id_changed, cand.date_changed, cand.ref_cand_pk, cand.ref_lst_updt_dt, 
cycle_data_available.max_cycle_available, cycle_data_available.min_cycle_available, 
CASE WHEN cand.cand_election_yr > cycle_data_available.max_cycle_available 
THEN cand.cand_election_yr WHEN cand.cand_election_yr < 
cycle_data_available.min_cycle_available THEN cand.cand_election_yr WHEN 
cand.cand_election_yr = cand.fec_election_yr THEN cand.cand_election_yr WHEN 
(cand.cand_election_yr % 2::numeric) = 1::numeric AND substr(cand.cand_id::text, 1, 1) = 
'H'::text THEN CASE WHEN cand.fec_election_yr <= (cand.cand_election_yr + 
cand.cand_election_yr % 2::numeric) THEN cand.cand_election_yr ELSE NULL::numeric END 
WHEN yrs.next_election IS NULL THEN CASE WHEN cand.fec_election_yr <= 
(yrs.cand_election_yr + yrs.cand_election_yr % 2::numeric) AND (yrs.cand_election_yr - 
cand.fec_election_yr) < candidate_election_duration(cand.cand_id::text)::numeric THEN 
yrs.cand_election_yr ELSE NULL::numeric END WHEN cand.fec_election_yr > 
cand.cand_election_yr AND (yrs.next_election % 2::numeric) = 1::numeric AND 
cand.fec_election_yr < yrs.next_election AND cand.fec_election_yr <= (yrs.next_election + yrs.next_election % 2::numeric - candidate_election_duration(cand.cand_id::text)::numeric) 
THEN NULL::numeric WHEN cand.fec_election_yr > cand.cand_election_yr AND cand.fec_election_yr 
< yrs.next_election AND cand.fec_election_yr > (yrs.next_election - 
candidate_election_duration(cand.cand_id::text)::numeric) THEN yrs.next_election  WHEN 
cand.fec_election_yr > cand.cand_election_yr AND cand.fec_election_yr <= (yrs.next_election - 
candidate_election_duration(cand.cand_id::text)::numeric) THEN NULL::numeric WHEN 
cand.fec_election_yr < cand.cand_election_yr AND (yrs.cand_election_yr - cand.fec_election_yr) 
< candidate_election_duration(cand.cand_id::text)::numeric THEN yrs.cand_election_yr ELSE 
NULL::numeric END::numeric(4,0) AS election_year, yrs.next_election  FROM 
disclosure.cand_valid_fec_yr cand  LEFT JOIN cand_election_yrs yrs ON cand.cand_id::text = 
yrs.cand_id::text AND cand.cand_election_yr = yrs.cand_election_yr, cycle_data_available ORDER 
BY cand.cand_id, cand.fec_election_yr ), elections AS (  SELECT dedup.cand_id, 
array_agg(dedup.cand_office_district)::text[] AS election_districts FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT ON 
(fec_yr_1.cand_id, fec_yr_1.cand_election_yr) fec_yr_1.cand_valid_yr_id, fec_yr_1.cand_id, 
fec_yr_1.fec_election_yr, fec_yr_1.cand_election_yr, fec_yr_1.cand_office_district, 
fec_yr_1.election_year FROM fec_yr fec_yr_1 ORDER BY fec_yr_1.cand_id, fec_yr_1.cand_election_yr, 
fec_yr_1.fec_election_yr) dedup GROUP BY dedup.cand_id ), cycles AS ( SELECT 
fec_yr_1.cand_id, max(fec_yr_1.cand_election_yr) AS active_through, array_agg(DISTINCT 
fec_yr_1.cand_election_yr)::integer[] AS election_years, 
array_agg(fec_yr_1.fec_election_yr)::integer[] AS cycles, max(fec_yr_1.fec_election_yr) AS 
max_cycle, array_agg(DISTINCT fec_yr_1.cand_election_yr + fec_yr_1.cand_election_yr % 
2::numeric)::integer[] AS rounded_election_years FROM fec_yr fec_yr_1 GROUP BY 
fec_yr_1.cand_id ), dates AS ( SELECT f_rpt_or_form_sub.cand_cmte_id AS cand_id, 
min(f_rpt_or_form_sub.receipt_dt) AS first_file_date, max(f_rpt_or_form_sub.receipt_dt) AS 
last_file_date, max(f_rpt_or_form_sub.receipt_dt) FILTER (WHERE f_rpt_or_form_sub.form_tp::text 
= 'F2'::text) AS last_f2_date FROM disclosure.f_rpt_or_form_sub WHERE 
substr(f_rpt_or_form_sub.cand_cmte_id::text, 1, 1) = ANY (ARRAY['S'::text, 'H'::text, 'P'::text]) 
GROUP BY f_rpt_or_form_sub.cand_cmte_id ), fec_cycles_in_election AS ( SELECT 
ofec_cand_cmte_linkage_vw.cand_id, array_agg(DISTINCT 
ofec_cand_cmte_linkage_vw.fec_election_yr)::integer[] AS fec_cycles_in_election FROM 
ofec_cand_cmte_linkage_vw WHERE ofec_cand_cmte_linkage_vw.election_yr_to_be_included IS 
NOT NULL AND (ofec_cand_cmte_linkage_vw.cmte_dsgn::text = ANY (ARRAY['P'::character 
varying, 'A'::character varying]::text[])) GROUP BY ofec_cand_cmte_linkage_vw.cand_id ) 
SELECT row_number() OVER () AS idx, fec_yr.lst_updt_dt AS load_date, fec_yr.fec_election_yr AS 
two_year_period, fec_yr.election_year AS candidate_election_year, fec_yr.cand_id AS 
candidate_id, fec_yr.cand_name AS name, fec_yr.cand_state AS address_state, fec_yr.cand_city 
AS address_city, fec_yr.cand_st1 AS address_street_1, fec_yr.cand_st2 AS address_street_2, 
fec_yr.cand_zip AS address_zip, fec_yr.cand_ici AS incumbent_challenge, 
expand_candidate_incumbent(fec_yr.cand_ici::text) AS incumbent_challenge_full, 
fec_yr.cand_status AS candidate_status, inactive.cand_id IS NOT NULL AS candidate_inactive, 
fec_yr.cand_office AS office, expand_office(fec_yr.cand_office::text) AS office_full, 
fec_yr.cand_office_st AS state, fec_yr.cand_office_district AS district, 
fec_yr.cand_office_district::integer AS district_number, fec_yr.cand_pty_affiliation AS party, 
clean_party(ref_party.pty_desc::text) AS party_full, cycles.cycles, dates.first_file_date::text::date 
AS first_file_date, dates.last_file_date::text::date AS last_file_date, dates.last_f2_date::text::date 
AS last_f2_date, cycles.election_years, elections.election_districts, cycles.active_through, 
fec_cycles_in_election.fec_cycles_in_election, cycles.rounded_election_years FROM fec_yr LEFT 
JOIN cycles USING (cand_id) LEFT JOIN elections USING (cand_id) LEFT JOIN dates USING 
(cand_id) LEFT JOIN fec_cycles_in_election USING (cand_id) LEFT JOIN 
disclosure.cand_inactive inactive ON fec_yr.cand_id::text = inactive.cand_id::text AND 
fec_yr.election_year = inactive.election_yr LEFT JOIN staging.ref_pty ref_party ON 
fec_yr.cand_pty_affiliation::text = ref_party.pty_cd::text WHERE cycles.max_cycle >= 
1979::numeric AND NOT (fec_yr.cand_id::text IN ( SELECT DISTINCT unverified_filers_vw.cmte_id 
FROM unverified_filers_vw WHERE unverified_filers_vw.cmte_id::text ~ 
similar_escape('(P|S|H)%'::text, NULL::text)))) as q where q.candidate_id = 'H6MD08549';
```

### Steps to reproduce
https://www.fec.gov/data/candidate/H6MD08549/ (see that 2018 is not an option)

### Work so far
in `ofec_candidate_history_mv`, this is the section of logic that generates the NULL for this candidate: 
```sql
WHEN cand.fec_election_yr > cand.cand_election_yr 
AND cand.fec_election_yr <= (yrs.next_election - 
candidate_election_duration(cand.cand_id::text)::numeric) 
THEN NULL::numeric
```
i.e., this evaluates as 
WHEN 2018 > 2016 AND 2018 <= (2020 - 2) THEN NULL
WHEN 2018 > 2016 AND 2018 <= 2018 THEN NULL
WHEN TRUE AND TRUE THEN NULL

body:
It appears that not all candidate names are being returned using the candidate_search query param. Below is an example:

You can see that "Love" is within the candidate name column on the datatable (screenshot below).

**Completion criteria:**

title: Filings API: Incorrect fec_url and pdf_url values
body:
### Description

Images prior to 2000 are not being displayed on FEC.gov, even if a PDF exists. The URL is not being generated, so the front-end doesn't have anything to pass to docquery. We need to correct this so that users are able to access are more "historical" images, regardless of when they were made. 

Example:

- https://www.fec.gov/data/committee/C00213512/?tab=filings&cycle=1998
- expand the panel for RFAI: POST-GENERAL 1998

The data returned includes
- null value for `pdf_url`. The pdf exists.
- semi-legit value for `fec_url`, except there's no filename—only a path and file extension. (The string.format is being given a null?)

### Desired behavior

Proper values should be returned for `pdf_url` and `fec_url`

**Completion criteria:**
- [ ] If the FEC link exists, the PDF should show. It's currently appearing as expected on classic.fec.gov

title: Schedule A, B, and E aggregate endpoints can't filter by committee ID
body:
The endpoints:
```
/schedules/schedule_a/by_size/
/schedules/schedule_a/by_state/
/schedules/schedule_a/by_zip/
/schedules/schedule_a/by_employer/
/schedules/schedule_a/by_occupation/
/schedules/schedule_b/by_recipient/
/schedules/schedule_b/by_recipient_id/
/schedules/schedule_b/by_purpose/
/schedules/schedule_e/by_candidate/
```
...should have the ability to filter by one or more committee ID (the filer ID) but they don't. In comparison, these endpoints use the same resource files as `/commitee/<commitee_ID>/schedules/schedule_a/by_state/` etc which do filter by a required committeeID parameter.

**Code for two aggregate endpoints per view**
https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/blob/20e55b379b55baa17abd0be5f2595adfec5e390b/webservices/rest.py#L332-L350

This is pretty difficult to split out because the committee_id filter is "automagically" added by a combination of packages when it's in the URL but not otherwise. I put together a prototype of trying to split this logic out: https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/pull/3994. I think it's pretty involved. We'll also need to fix our automated tests because if we take this approach the `url_for` may need to point to the new view.

**Completion criteria**
- [ ] Add `committee_id` as a filter_multi to these endpoints
- [ ] Make sure `committee_id` isn't added to the `/commitee/<commitee_ID>/schedules/schedule_a/by_state/` etc. endpoints

body:
The paragraph below is incorrect. (papagraph source: https://api.open.fec.gov/developers/#/receipts/get_schedules_schedule_a_)

```
When comparing the totals from reports to line items. the totals will not match unless you
only look at items where "is_individual":true since the same transaction is in the data
multiple ways to explain the way it may move though different committees as an earmark.
See the is_individual sql function within the migrations for more details.
```

`Is_individual` will never sum to the amount on one line number of the detailed summary page. `Is_individual` pulls coded data (from any line it was reported on) and data from Lines 11(a)(i) and 12 or Lines 17(a)(i) and 18 depending on form type.

- [ ] update `docs.py`

title: Counts estimate significantly off from actual count on raw IE datatable
body: **What we're after:** A bug was discovered with the estimated counts on the raw IE datatable. As of 9/10/19 it was displaying `9,919,673,000` when the actual count was `545,952`. We have it set that an estimate is sufficient when the count is over 500,000. It seems that because the actual count is over 500,000, it's not taken into account, so it's spitting out something that is severely inaccurate. We need to determine how to fix this in a way that provides a more accurate count of what actually exists in the data. Without a solution, this is a problem that will perpetuate as we continue to receive new data. **Example:** https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/schedules/schedule_e/efile/?api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort_hide_null=false&sort_nulls_last=true&data_type=efiling&is_notice=true&sort=-expenditure_date&per_page=30&page=1 **Completion criteria:** - [x] Raw filing data is being actively being reduced to 4 months. We are testing in staging and will be moving to apply to production soon. See ticket: https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/issues/3789 - [x] After stage and production data is reduced, check the actual database counts of raw IE data vs what's displayed on the page and in the API call. The assumption is the totals should be more accurate.

title: Research: Make sure sqlAlchemy decimal places are rounded to two places
body:
## Summary ##
Querying the following in Chrome vs. Chrome Incognito mode yield results having different decimal places:

"https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/schedules/schedule_a/by_size/by_candidate/?sort_hide_null=false&page=1&api_key=DEMO_KEY&candidate_id=P80001571&election_full=false&per_page=20&cycle=2020&sort_null_only=false&sort_nulls_last=false"

Need to verify that decimal precision is set to maximum of 2 places in columns and operations. May need to consider rounding in final step for any operations having intermediate calculations to avoid accumulation of error.

Note that querying swagger ui and using the following script shows 2 decimal places:

```python
import pandas as pd
import json
import requests

api_url = "https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/schedules/schedule_a/by_size/by_candidate/? 
    sort_hide_null=false&page=1&api_key=DEMO_KEY&candidate_id=P80001571&election_full=
    false&per_page=20&cycle=2020&sort_null_only=false&sort_nulls_last=false"

df = pd.read_json(api_url, typ=dict)
for r in df.results:
    print(r['total'])

response = requests.get(api_url)
print(json.loads(response.content.decode('utf-8')))
```

[edited formatting]

title: account for accents in alphanumeric input for tsvector
body:
## Summary ##
Filers may submit text that contains accents. Currently, non-English alphabet and non-numeric characters are stripped from filed data to construct the `tsvector` column that is searched. Accents need to be passed and not stripped.

## Completion criteria ##
- [x] install postgres extension `unaccent` for all environments and schema
    - [x]  `CREATE EXTENSION unaccent;` (related issue #3862)
- [x] make SQL function to generate the input argument to `to_tsvector`, i.e., return a string to be used as input. 
    - [x] When the `unaccent`ed string is the same as the input string, treat as:
        `regexp_replace(<string>, '[^a-zA-Z0-9]', ' ', 'g'))`
    - [x] When the `unaccent`ed string is different from the input string, treat as:
        `concat(regexp_replace(unaccent(<string>), '[^a-zA-Z0-9]', ' ', 'g'), ' ', 
regexp_replace(<string>, '[^[:alnum:]]', ' ', 'g'));`
- [x] make new migration file (reference `V0142_`)
- [x] account for diacritical marks in `utils.parse_fulltext()`
- [x] update `requirements.txt` with necessary libraries
- [ ] add diacritical marks test for `pytest`

title: fix parse_fulltext()
body:
**Problem**
When model fields are specified as `fulltext` fields (e.g., `RadAnalystView`'s `filter_fulltext_fields`) there appears to be behavior leading to **unexpected API returns** (notable when the database column is of type `varchar` and when the searched database value is in the form of single string having no whitespace characters but having special characters, e.g., a full email address or a company name such as "company.com".

**Background**
The `filter_fulltext` method calls the `parse_fulltext` method, which takes an user-specified input field and replaces any `\W` characters with `' '` (one whitespace character) and returns a formatted query as an argument to `to_tsquery()`.

For example, if the user input is `user@fec.gov` and the corresponding searched values are in `table.email` (thing they are searching for) then the resulting query will be of the form:

```sql
select <columns> from table
where table.email @@ to_tsquery('user: * & fec:* & gov:*');
```

And the query will return no rows. But the query

```sql
select <columns> from table
where table.email @@ to_tsquery('user@fec.gov');
```
will return the desired rows.

**Suggested steps**
- [x] Investigate the behavior when column types are specified as `TSVECTOR`
- [ ] Investigate other tables/views where this behavior may give unexpected results (e.g., aggregate by employer)
- [ ] consider adding to automated test coverage

**Proximate code**
```python
def filter_fulltext(query, kwargs, fields):
    for key, column in fields:
        if kwargs.get(key):
            exclude_list = build_exclude_list(kwargs.get(key))
            include_list = build_include_list(kwargs.get(key))
            if exclude_list:
                filters = [
                    sa.not_(column.match(utils.parse_fulltext(value)))
                    for value in exclude_list
                ]
                query = query.filter(sa.and_(*filters))
            if include_list:
                filters = [
                    column.match(utils.parse_fulltext(value))
                    for value in include_list
                ]
                query = query.filter(sa.or_(*filters))
    return query
```

and subroutine `parse_fulltext()`:
```python
def parse_fulltext(text):
    return ' & '.join([
        part + ':*'
        for part in re.sub(r'\W', ' ', text).split()
    ])
```

title: API rate limits not enforced correctly
body:
It appears we've been receiving reports that personal API keys that users have been using is not allowing them the full amount of calls as the limit entails.

For example, a user may have a rate limit of 120 requests per minute, however, they receive an over the rate limit after making only a little over a hundred calls over 24 hours.

title: API not properly caching
body:
It looks like the API isn't caching properly in either `stage` or `prod`. I confirmed with both `CURL` and in Chrome. 

The API umbrella is [supposed to respect and enforce caching headers](https://api-umbrella.readthedocs.io/en/latest/admin/api-backends/caching.html#cache-control-max-age) set by the `max-age` value, but the following calls are repeatedly `MISS`ing and not increasing the age appropriately:

**Stage**
- Base URL (60 min): `curl -I "http://api-stage.open.fec.gov"`
- Schedule A (60 min): `curl -I "https://api-stage.open.fec.gov/v1/schedules/schedule_a/?api_key=DEMO_KEY"`
- Legal (5 min): `curl -I "http://api-stage.open.fec.gov/v1/legal/search/?description=excessive&ao_is_pending=True&type=advisory_opinions&api_key=DEMO_KEY"`

**Prod**
- Base URL (60 min): `curl -I "http://api.open.fec.gov"`
- Schedule A (60 min): `curl -I "https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/schedules/schedule_a/?api_key=DEMO_KEY"`
- Legal (5 min): `curl -I "http://api.open.fec.gov/v1/legal/search/?description=excessive&ao_is_pending=True&type=advisory_opinions&api_key=DEMO_KEY"`

api.data.gov did perform system upgrades on 2/23/19, but we should investigate further before reaching out to them.

**Completion criteria**
- [x] Try removing the [`public` part of the response header](https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/blob/develop/webservices/rest.py#L179) to see if that works with a test deploy to `stage` (API umbrella docs don't include "public" specifically but this is a valid option - maybe that's part of the disconnect)
- [X] ~Set up the `stage` "override headers" section in the API umbrella admin to match `prod` for consistency/control purposes, test again~ we removed "override headers" setting in the API umbrella admin in `prod` and tested again - still not working. What's also interesting is the API umbrella wasn't enforcing the override setting "Cache-Control: s-maxage=600" either.
- [X] Reach out to API umbrella support (api.data.gov@gsa.gov) to see if they can help (email text below)
- [ ] Get the  API umbrella working locally to try to debug the issue

title: Operating expenditures wrong on committee profile page
body:
https://www.fec.gov/data/committee/C00011262/

The value for operating expenditures is incorrect here and also on other form 3X filing committees I've looked at.  The ofec_totals_combined_mv is using only the op_exp_per column which works for form 3 and 3p but form 3x needs to use the ttl_op_exp_per column. I believe this change will solve the problem:

in ofec_totals_combined_mv, change this line:

sum(vsd.op_exp_per)

to this line (or it's functional equivalent)ncase when vsd.form_tp_cd = 'F3X' then sum(vsd.ttl_op_exp_per) else sum(vsd.op_exp_per) end  operating_expenditures,

@rjayasekera

title: Filter for single day (raw filings)

**What we are after**:
Provide users with an intuitive way to search for a single day's filings. For example, I want to see all raw electronic filings received on 2/1/19.

To help users find filings and reports they are looking for. 

**Current behavior**:
Entry in both date boxes:

Entering the same date in both date boxes should return filings received on that day.

title: Research: For paper filings, we're missing current version information
body:
**User story:** As a researcher, I want to be able to find the latest versions of committee filings, so that I can stay up-to-date and informed on the money being raised and spent. 

This may affect the versioning displaying on the front-end, which may create confusion for our users to understand where the latest filing information is located. We should be able to distinguish between older filings and reports and the most recent version. 

Filings with negative file_number or blank previous_file_number are not shown correctly in amendment chain tables, especially for paper filing. 

**Completion criteria:**
- [x] Look at the creation script of the materialized view for paper filings. Check for incorrect logic.
- [x] Find problem data sets that will help to give us a baseline from which to debug
- [x] Document the logic problems with this script based on findings
- [x] Make a new ticket to fix the logic based on documented findings

title: Add prev_file_num and amndt_ind to /schedules/schedule_e/ endpoint
body:
Users need to have the amendment indicator and previous file_num when they export independent expenditure data in order to make sense of the data. In order for that to happen it needs to be added to the `/schedules/schedule_e/ ` endpoint.

The /schedules/Schedule_e endpoint does not include these two columns but now there is a materialized view in Dev, the public.ofec_schedule_e_temp_mv that is a copy of the ofec_schedule_e_mv with `prev_file_num` and `amndt_ind` added. It should be used for developing and testing the API.

Completion Criteria:
- [x]  Add amndt_ind and prev_file_num to endpoint
- [x]  test ie export to make sure the columns are added to the export.  https://www.fec.gov/data/independent-expenditures/?data_type=processed&committee_id=C00680926&is_notice=true

title: Schedule_e pagination and missing transactions bug
body:
I'm trying to query independent expenditures by committee. I've noticed a bug in the pagination mechanism that results in many transactions being excluded. I'll use the DCCC as an example.

The following will query the first 100 IEs for DCCC during the 2016 cycle:
https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/schedules/schedule_e/?api_key=DEMO_KEY&committee_id=C00000935&per_page=100&cycle=2016&sort=-expenditure_date

It also returns the following pagination object:
```
"pagination":{"per_page":100,"count":7926,"pages":80,"last_indexes":{"last_index":"4081120171446520621","last_expenditure_date":"2016-11-03T00:00:00"}}
```

Following the documentation, appending the `last_index` value to the end of the request like `&last_index=4081120171446520621` will return the the next page of results in sequence, and so on until no results are left. By the estimation given in the pagination object there should be 80 pages of results, however following the `last_index` yields only 9 more pages:
```
last_index
4081120171446520621
4081120171446520421
4081120171446520221
4081120171446520021
4081120171446519821
4081120171446519621
4061620171409944984
4061620171409944784
4042220161283669188
```

### Missing Transactions:
https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/schedules/schedule_e/?min_amount=134680.46&cycle=2016&committee_id=C00000935&per_page=20&sort=-expenditure_date&api_key=DEMO_KEY&max_amount=134680.46

These transactions (and many more) should be returned by the first request, but are not found on any of the pages.

title: Need to remove AO citation from AO 2011-12 canonical page
body:
We've picked up a date, rather than an AO number, when parsing AOs cited within an AO https://www.fec.gov/data/legal/search/advisory-opinions/?type=advisory_opinions&ao_no=2011-12&ao_category=F . We need to remove AO 2017-03 from the list of later opinions that cite AO 2011-12.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13237823/45891582-f13dc700-bd93-11e8-80b3-9337cca9bad9.png)

It appears we've grabbed that reference out of the following sentence in AO 2017-03: "For example, three of the AUA’s six most recent presidents (serving in 2010-11, 2011-12, and 2015-16) had previously been president of AACU."

title: Create ofec_all_report_mv
body:
continue from [#3230](https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/issues/3230)

**What we're after:**
This ticket is to track the implementation of creating the materialized view.  Right now each type of reports has its own table, and which table to be used for searching is depended on the type of reports.   Sometimes committee may file wrong reports to FEC.  For example, a house/senate committee files a F3X instead of F3.  If searching for reports by that committee from this page,  the F3X will not show up for the committee.
https://www.fec.gov/data/advanced/?tab=filings

To repair this, a materialized view that includes F3, F3x and F3p will be created and used for reports searching

**Completion criteria:**
- [x] create materialized view
- [ ] make sure the mv is refreshed every night
- [ ] Make sure to test:
   - [ ] Test the totals to make sure that they are still correct. 
   - [ ] Find some examples of committees who have filed more than one Form 3. 
   - [ ] Look at all the references from the old MV to the new MV. 
   - [ ] Make sure amendments versions will still show up ok.
- [ ] Create a new testing ticket after this is merged to make sure things check out. Make testing ticket based on completion criteria.

title: Remove incumbent data from /elections/search/ endpoint
body:
Remove incumbent data from /elections/search/ endpoint - there are data problems and this is unused on the front end. Election profile pages pull data from /elections/ 

## Method
To check the incumbent flags in the /elections/ endpoint, @llienfec pulled data from the /elections/search/ API endpoint (had all the needed data).  Compared incumbents listed by district to external data sources, looking for discrepancies and researching the differences.  It was a lot of data, so apologies for any oversights/spelling issues! 

## Data
Lauren's full research notes are here: 
:lock: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1N-v4NSycB6JE54BIRmrvWPI74F-GA8C82Nb5lgRuEcM/edit?usp=sharing :lock: 
@rhoughfec is good at interpreting my massive spreadsheets in case anything needs deciphering while I'm out of the office next week.

## Findings summary
- Most common error: districts that had special elections, resignations, deaths are out of date.
- "Null" for the incumbent value is used inconsistently.  Seems like it should be used when the seat is vacant (examples: MI 13, TX 27) or maybe when the person in the office was appointed and not elected.
- Pennsylvania's redistricting moved incumbents around.  The 1:1 ratio between districts and incumbents doesn't work 2 PA districts.
- Less common error: winner from 2016 wasn't flagged properly

title: Fix archived MURs with wrong names, only partial PDFs
body:
A handful of archived MURs came in with the wrong MUR no - they shouldn't have the `_A`. We confirmed these on classic.

Because of the wrong numbers, they're not coming up in results because a user searching "1252" (the correct number) won't find "1252_A" (what we've named it).

9 Examples:
1252_A
1503_A
1704_A
253_A
2583_A
2667_A
2804_A
2892_A
3485_A

After discussing this with Jason, I realize the issue is more complex than we previously thought - Currently, the “_A” PDF’s are only part “_A” of the MUR - the canonical page should link to all PDF’s. So in the “2892” example, there are 5 PDF’s we need to associate with that number, and currently we’re only associating one “_A” PDF with that MUR. Just renaming these won’t be enough.

It looks like our system for archived MURs is set up on a `1-1` relationship between MURs and their PDFs, but this is actually a `1-many` relationship for these 9 MURs that have multiple parts. We’ll need to re-think our work to fix this issue.

- [x] Check for duplicates - are there current MURs with these numbers? 
- [x] Make a snapshot of the Archived MUR index in elasticsearch
- ~[ ] Fix the schema to handle `one-many` archived MURs - PDFs~ no schema change needed - shared w/current MURs
- [x] Modify reload to handle nested documents
- [X] Implement front end (PR https://github.com/fecgov/fec-cms/pull/2185)
- [X] test `dev` - merge front end PR
- [X] reload one multi and one multiple archived MUR with a headless app, (2583 and 2584), make sure nothing breaks. 
- [x] Merge PR
[Reload progress here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12h_lI8_Lsau31WbRntdr1sx0DvovRc_Dd2QeaFlBft8/edit#gid=0)
- [x] Dev - Load these 9 MURs with with `load_archived_murs`  and delete old `_A` archived murs*, Make a snapshot after
Release branch is cut
- [x] Stage - Load these 9 MURs with with `load_archived_murs` and delete old `_A` archived murs*, Make a snapshot after
7/31 Release is deployed to prod
- [x] Prod - Load these 9 MURs with with `load_archived_murs` and delete old `_A` archived murs*, Make a snapshot after
- [ ] Update documentation on loading archived MURs

*
```
cf ssh api
--!! DELETE by query

curl -X POST "<URI>/archived_murs/murs/_delete_by_query" -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d'
{
    "query": {
        "wildcard" : { "no" : "*_A" }
    }
}
'
```

Better not to do this by hand - less error-prone, more exposure

title: Elections endpoint is including joint fundraisers and inflating candidate receipts and disbursements
body:
https://www.fec.gov/data/elections/senate/VA/2018/

There are several issues with the SQL in the elections endpoint:

1. it is including joint fundraisers so any candidate that has one or more joint fundraiser has inflated figures (because the joint fundraising committee transfers money to the candidate committee so the money is already there)
  
- [x] add AND ofec_cand_cmte_linkage_mv.cmte_dsgn in ('A','P') to the anon_4 where clause

2. There are two tables that we use to make sure candidates are not on the list:
   disclosure.cand_inactive (for candidates that withdraw from an election) which is already included in one of the underlying views and:
   disclosure.unverified_cand_cmte (for candidates or committees that have been removed for administrative reasons) which is not accounted for

- [ ] Add unverified candidate statement to the where clause of the **anon_4** sub select:  
AND ofec_cand_cmte_linkage_mv.cand_id not in (select cand_cmte_id from disclosure.unverified_cand_cmte)

title: [V0086] Fix candidate totals for future elections

Links: - http://localhost:8000/data/candidates/president/?election_year=2020&cycle=2020&election_full=true - http://localhost:8000/data/candidates/senate/?election_year=2022&cycle=2018&election_full=false - You can test raising/spending breakdowns if you run the older branch `feature/add-suite-to-committee-address` ## Impacted areas of the application List general components of the application that this PR will affect: - /candidates/totals endpoint - fec.gov/data/candidates/president/ - fec.gov/data/candidates/house/ (should be no change) - fec.gov/data/candidates/senate/ - Raising/Spending breakdowns when we bring them back ## Before - no data 👎 ## After - data! 👍 ## Related PRs Branched `from feature/fix-special-candidate-totals`, PR: https://github.com/fecgov/openFEC/pull/3198

```    'P': models.CommitteeTotalsPresidential = ofec_totals_presidential_mv
    'H': models.CommitteeTotalsHouseSenate = ofec_totals_house_senate_mv

```

title: Fix totals for off-year special candidates on /candidates/totals endpoint
body:
## Summary (required)

- Resolves #3196 and Resolves #3200. The /candidates/totals endpoint was doubling totals for odd-year special election candidates, and missing at least one odd-year special election candidate

### 1) #3196: Fixes incorrect totals for /candidates/totals/ for off-year special election candidates

Change to `ofec_candidate_totals_mv`:
Add a `SELECT DISTINCT`:
```
 ), link AS ( --Off-year special election candidates have > 1 row/cycle
         SELECT DISTINCT cand_id,
            cand_election_yr + cand_election_yr % 2 as rounded_election_yr,
            fec_election_yr,
            cmte_id,
            cmte_dsgn
          FROM ofec_cand_cmte_linkage_mv
          WHERE cmte_dsgn IN ('P', 'A')
```
| cand_id   | cand_election_yr   | fec_election_yr   | cmte_id   | cmte_tp   | cmte_dsgn   
|-------|--------------|-----------|--------------------|-------------------|-----------|
| S0AL00156 | 2018               | 2018              | C00640623 | S         | P           | P  |
| S0AL00156 | 2017               | 2018              | C00640623 | S         | P           | P  |

### Performance
Before: 87037 rows, cost=(22821.52..22840.34)
After: 87037 rows, cost=(17454.39..17462.67)

Example: Doug Jones, Raised

| Total raised   | Total Receipts (from candidate page)|
|----------------|--------------------------------------|
| $46,956,378.00 | $23,478,189.00                       |

Incorrect totals in API call:
https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/candidates/totals/?api_key=DEMO_KEY&per_page=20&page=1&candidate_id=S0AL00156&cycle=2018

### 2) #3200 : Fixes missing off-year special candidates

 Change to `ofec_candidate_totals_with_0s_mv`: Remove restrictive join on totals (`ofec_candidate_totals_mv`) that was preventing odd-year special candidates who didn't run again (H8GA06195 is an example) from showing up:
~`AND cand.candidate_election_year = totals.election_year`~

Missing candidate in API call (top raising candidate in 2018)
https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/candidates/totals/?api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort_hide_null=true&q=H8GA06195&cycle=2018&sort=-receipts&per_page=30&page=1&office=H

Data tracking: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1NUlhWZ6aHvNNSugPk3BWemDQSZn3pimjbqW_4IC_cnw/edit#gid=1784243483

### Background

- Resource is `TotalsCandidateView` 
- MV is `ofec_candidate_totals_with_0s_mv` which relies on `ofec_candidate_totals_mv`
- `ofec_candidate_totals_mv` has incorrect totals for Doug Jones (S0AL00156)
- The problem is with the join on `ofec_cand_cmte_linkage_mv` - off-year special election candidates will have two entries for 2018 in there.




## Impacted areas:
- https://www.fec.gov/data/candidates/senate/
- https://www.fec.gov/data/candidates/house/
- https://www.fec.gov/data/raising/
- https://www.fec.gov/data/spending
- Top raising candidates here: https://www.fec.gov/data/

## How to test locally
- Testing migration: Drop and recreate your local `cfdm_test` db, then `invoke create_sample_db`
## Testing real data: 
- Connect your `SQLA_CONN` to the `dev` database. 
 (There is an `ofec_candidate_totals_mv_tmp` and `ofec_candidate_totals_with_0s_mv_tmp` based off it for data testing.)
- To use these MV's, change `CandidateTotal(db.Model)` in `webservices/common/models/candidates.py` to point to `ofec_candidate_totals_with_0s_mv_tmp` 
-  Test totals for off-year special election candidates. S0AL00156 and H8GA06195 are a start, but extra eyes on other candidates are helpful. Compare totals to https://www.fec.gov/data/candidate/<ID>/ page. Can use "Impacted areas" to see where these appear on the front end https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1r9QtqGwWrK5ZZVz3tTBB8TpmDzPBgjzOvCmuHrbQ6tg/edit#gid=0

## Outstanding items
- [x] Figure out how to change this MV when other MV's depend on it <- You need to drop and re-create MV's that depend on it.
- [X] Ask DB team about performance - this is slower than before <- Moved the SELECT DISTINCT for link into a subquery and performance beat the old query - thanks @ChingKuan!
- [X] Once we can rename the MV/Indexes, check to make sure `rename_indexes` works <- I think this might be case sensitive? Will test if I can
- [x] Jon Ossoff, the top raising candidate for 2017-2018, is missing from this endpoint: https://api.open.fec.gov/v1/candidates/totals/?api_key=DEMO_KEY&sort_hide_null=true&q=H8GA06195&cycle=2018&sort=-receipts&per_page=30&page=1&office=H
- [x] Update comments with new changes
- [X] Create `_tmp` for testing data
- [x] Add tests for odd-year house/senate special candidates

title: Research - Most recent filing of form 5s doesn't work for first time filers
body:
This is a medium profile bug that will get higher as we get closer to the election. I think this has been reported and researched before but I cant find it. 

Background:
On the filings pages (both filings search and filings on committee profile) reports that show up have been through overnight processing. In order to also show efilings that have come in since the overnight process kicked off (7:00 pm or so) we have a special process that displays them for a few days at the top of the filings list. After a few days they go away because they have been through the overnight process and are displayed in their correct location on the list.

Here is the issue:
In order to file most forms - like forms 3, 3x and 3p you first must file a form 1 that creates your committee and then the committee can file the reports. Form 5 and possibly form 9 can be filed by an individual who has never filed a form 1. In this case a form 1Z is automatically created. This creates the entity so that it can be treated like a committee in the system. 

Here are two scenarios that demonstrate the problem:

Take the case of Mary who has filed form 5 for several years. She has an ID that was created for her the first time she filed a form 5 - C90001234 . She also filed a new form 5 two minutes ago.

Also take the case of Jake who filed his first form 5 ever two minutes ago. The automated process that creates his Form 1z and thus his "committee" will happen as part of tonight's process.

You go to our website and search for Mary and you find her and you see her newly filed form 5.

You search for Jake and find nothing. You search for all form 5s and you don't find Jake's form 5.
This is because there is no entity yet for Jake and the search is  looking for filings filed by entities so it doesn't find Jake because he won't show up in the system until tonight even though his form 5 is available in the database that feeds the API.

Jake will be good tomorrow but Jake is unhappy today. We want Jake to be happy.

Solution possibilities:
1. Change the SQL for the  API filings endpoint so it includes form 5s and possibly 9s that have no committee. In this case the "committee" information should come from the filing itself - for example "committee name" would come from the filer name on the form.
2: Make a trigger or something in the electronic filing form 5 table that checks to see if a committee exists for the filer and if not create one. This would have to be done in a way that the created committee would be replaced overnight by the one that the system already creates n FECP.

3. Change the view that feeds the committees endpoint so that it unions "committees from form 5 that don't exist in the committee tables. This creates an entity so the search will work and it will only happen until the actual form 1z is replicated.
